nodes.text: Groth was a planet that was located within the star system of the same name and lay deep within the Bootana Hutta area of the galaxy's Hutt Space region. A former throneworld of the Hutt species, the planet eventually became a resort that was the site of gladiatorial exhibitions and gambling. During the Cold War between the Galactic Republic and the resurgent Sith Empire in the year 3643 BBY, an information broker on Groth sliced into the military database of the Empire.

Groth was a world that was located within the Groth system. It constituted a part of the Bootana Hutta area of the galaxy's Hutt Space region. Three small hyperlanes connected Groth to Sakiya, Kor Desilijic and the Kor Trinivii system.

The territory surrounding Groth had come under the control of the sentient Hutt species as early as the year 22,000 BBY and was considered well-explored by 8000 BBY. At some point in Groth's history, the planet served as a Hutt throneworld, however it was eventually turned into a resort that was the site of gladiatorial exhibitions and gambling. During the Cold War between the Galactic Republic and the resurgent Sith Empire in 3643 BBY, an information broker on Groth sliced into the Empire's military database.
An individual who was affiliated with the Empire visited Groth at that time and captured both the information broker and his client list by luring the criminal into one of his own security traps.
The local population average of the region of space containing Groth around the year 25 ABY ranged from 100 million to 500 million.

Groth was first mentioned in The Essential Atlas—a reference book co-authored by Jason Fry and Daniel Wallace, and published on August 18, 2009—which placed the planet in grid square S-11. The planet was later mentioned again in Star Wars: The Old Republic, a massively multiplayer online roleplaying game developed by BioWare and released in 2011, in which it was used as a possible location for Imperial players to assign their companions on individual quests.
